title: Levitical Cities and Cities of Refuge
summary: Numbers 35 describes the 48 cities given to the Levites, including six cities of refuge for those who commit unintentional manslaughter. These cities protect the accused until a fair trial can take place.

faq.question: What were cities of refuge?
faq.answer: Safe places for those who accidentally killed someone to flee and await trial.

faq.question: Why were Levites given cities?
faq.answer: They had no land inheritance, so they were given cities scattered throughout Israel to serve the people.
